adm:managed-object.name: attribute-value-password-validator
adm:managed-object.adm:synopsis:
The
attempts to determine whether a proposed password is acceptable for use by determining whether that password is contained in any attribute within the user's entry.
adm:managed-object.adm:description: It can be configured to look in all attributes or in a specified subset of attributes.

adm:property.name: match-attribute
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies the name(s) of the attribute(s) whose values should be checked to determine whether they match the provided password. If no values are provided, then the server checks if the proposed password matches the value of any attribute in the user's entry.

adm:alias.adm:synopsis: All attributes in the user entry will be checked.

adm:property.name: check-substrings
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Indicates whether this password validator is to match portions of the password string against attribute values.
adm:property.adm:description: If "false" then only match the entire password against attribute values otherwise ("true") check whether the password contains attribute values.

adm:property.name: min-substring-length
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Indicates the minimal length of the substring within the password in case substring checking is enabled.
adm:property.adm:description: If "check-substrings" option is set to true, then this parameter defines the length of the smallest word which should be used for substring matching. Use with caution because values below 3 might disqualify valid passwords.

adm:property.name: test-reversed-password
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Indicates whether this password validator should test the reversed value of the provided password as well as the order in which it was given.
